snippet: When Donald J. Trump said the financial system was rigged, he tapped into a sentiment among many voters that powerful executives were being protected at their expense....
abstract: Gretchen Morgenson Fair Game column submits populist anger that led to Donald Trump's presidential victory was partially fueled by failure to jail or personally fine any top banking executive at major financial firm for their role in 2008 financial crisis; notes that this sent message to public that financial system was rigged; cites research indicating white-collar crime prosecution is down significantly this year, weakening its use as deterrent.
lead_paragraph: When Donald J. Trump said the financial system was rigged, he tapped into a sentiment among many voters that powerful executives were being protected at their expense.

headline.print_headline: The Impunity  That Main St. Didn’t Forget
headline.main: How Letting Bankers Off the Hook May Have Tipped the Election
